Question: Removing object from ArrayList in for each loop: :I would like to remove an object from an ArrayList when I'm done with it, but I can't find way to do it. Trying to remove it like in the sample code below doesn't want to work. How could I get to the iterator of current px object in this loop to remove it?    for( Pixel px : pixel){ [...]  if(px.y > gHeigh){     pixel.remove(pixel.indexOf(px)); // here is the thing     pixel.remove(px); //doesn't work either  }}
Please using this api: Iterator.next.
Answer: ASSISTANT:
response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: Iterator iterator = pixel.iterator();
while(iterator.hasNext()){
Pixel px = iterator.next();
if(px.y > gHeigh){
iterator.remove(); // Removes the current object from the ArrayList
}
}
<<<explanation>>>: The Iterator.next() method returns the next element in the iteration order of the iterator. In this case, it returns the current Pixel object that is being iterated over in the for-each loop. By calling Iterator.next() inside the loop, you can access the current object and remove it from the ArrayList using the Iterator.remove() method.
